title: Tommy Brasher
text: Tommy Brasher is an <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="coaching">coach</a> for the <a href="Kansas%20City%20Chiefs">Kansas City Chiefs</a>. He currently works on special projects for the Chiefs. He coached the <a href="Philadelphia%20Eagles">Philadelphia Eagles</a> line in 1985, then moved on to the <a href="Atlanta%20Falcons">Atlanta Falcons</a> until 1989. After this he went to the <a href="Tampa%20Bay%20Buccaneers">Tampa Bay Buccaneers</a> to coach for one year in 1990. He coached the <a href="Seattle%20Seahawks">Seattle Seahawks</a> Defensive line from 1992-1998. Then he went back to the Philadelphia Eagles from 1999, until 2005, when he retired. In 2001, he was awarded the Eagles <a href="Ed%20Block%20Courage%20Award">Ed Block Courage Award</a>. He came out of retirement in 2012 to rejoin the Eagles after the firing of <a href="Jim%20Washburn">Jim Washburn</a> to finish the season. After head coach <a href="Andy%20Reid">Andy Reid</a> was fired by the Eagles and hired by the Chiefs, Brasher was among the assistant coaches who followed Reid to Kansas City.
